title: Universally measurable set
summary: In mathematics, a subset A {\displaystyle A} of a Polish space X {\displaystyle X} is universally measurable if it is measurable with respect to every complete probability measure on X {\displaystyle X} that measures all Borel subsets of X {\displaystyle X} .  In particular, a universally measurable set of reals is necessarily Lebesgue measurable (see § Finiteness condition below).
